intro: Diphyllanthus duparquetianus, commonly known as the Congo flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and West Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
